questions.questionText: When was Roger Federer born?
questions.info: Roger Federer was born on August 8, 1981 in Basel, Switzerland

questions.questionText: When was Rafael Nadal born?
questions.info: Rafael Nadal was born on June 3, 1986 in Manacor, Mallorca, Spain

questions.questionText: When was Novak Djokovic born?
questions.info: Novak Djokovic was born on May 22, 1987 in Belgrade, Serbia

questions.questionText: What year did Roger Federer turn pro?
questions.info: Roger Federer made his debut on the ATP Tour in 1998.

questions.questionText: What year did Rafael Nadal turn pro?
questions.info: Rafael Nadal made his debut on the ATP Tour in 1998.

questions.questionText: What year did Novak Djokovic turn pro?
questions.info: Novak Djokovic made his debut on the ATP Tour in 2003.

questions.questionText: When did Roger Federer win his 1st Grand Slam?
questions.info: Roger Federer won his 1st Grand Slam, Wimbledon, in 2003.

questions.questionText: When did Rafael Nadal win his 1st Grand Slam?
questions.info: Rafael Nadal won Roland Garros, in 2005. He won on his 1st Roland Garros debut.

questions.questionText: When did Novak Djokovic win his 1st Grand Slam?
questions.info: Novak Djokovic won the Austrailian Open in 2008, becoming the 1st Serbian man to win a Grand Slam.

questions.questionText: What was the 1st year Roger Federer was No. 1 in the world?
questions.info: Roger Federer took the No. 1 ranking for his 1st time in 2004.

questions.questionText: What was the 1st year Rafael Nadal was No. 1 in the world?
questions.info: Rafael Nadal took the No. 1 ranking for his 1st time in 2008.

questions.questionText: What was the 1st year Novak Djokovic was No. 1 in the world?
questions.info: Novak Djokovic took the No. 1 ranking for his 1st time in 2011.

questions.questionText: How many years did Roger Federer finish the season No. 1 in the world?
questions.info: Roger Federer finished No. 1 in the world for 5 years.

questions.questionText: How many years did Rafael Nadal finish the season No. 1 in the world?
questions.info: Rafael Nadal finished No. 1 in the world for 5 years.

questions.questionText: How many years did Novak Djokovic finish the season No. 1 in the world?
questions.info: Novak Djokovic finished No. 1 in the world for 7 years.

questions.questionText: How old was Roger Federer when he won his 1st Grand Slam?
questions.info: Roger Federer won his 1st Grand Slam, Wimbledon, at 21.

questions.questionText: How old was Rafael Nadal when he won his 1st Grand Slam?
questions.info: Rafael Nadal won his 1st Grand Slam at 24.

questions.questionText: How old was Novak Djokovic when he won his 1st Grand Slam?
questions.info: Novak Djokovic won his 1st Grand Slam at 20.

questions.questionText: How old was Roger Federer when he turned pro?
questions.info: Roger Federer was 17 years old when he made his ATP Debut.

questions.questionText: How old was Rafael Nadal when he turned pro?
questions.info: Rafael Nadal turned pro at the young age of 15, but he didn't have much success initially.

questions.questionText: How old was Novak Djokovic when he turned pro?
questions.info: Novak Djokovic turned pro at 16, and 2 years after, he ended the year as the youngest player in the top 100.

questions.questionText: Who did Roger Federer beat in order to win his 1st Grand Slam?
questions.info: Roger Federer won his 1st Grand Slam beating Mark Philippousis in striaght sets.

questions.questionText: Who did Rafael Nadal beat in order to win his 1st Grand Slam?
questions.info: Rafael Nadal won his 1st Grand Slam beating Mariano Puerta in four sets.

questions.questionText: Who did Novak Djokovic beat in order to win his 1st Grand Slam?
questions.info: Novak Djokovic won his 1st Grand Slam beating Jo-Wilfried Tsonga in four sets.

questions.questionText: On what surface did Roger Federer win his 1st ever ATP title?
questions.info: Roger Federer won his 1st ATP title, the Milan Indoor, on carpet courts.

questions.questionText: On what surface did Rafael Nadal win his 1st ever ATP title?
questions.info: Rafael Nadal won his 1st ATP title, the Prokom Open, on clay courts.

questions.questionText: On what surface did Novak Djokovic win his 1st ever ATP title?
questions.info: Novak Djokovic won his 1st ATP title, the Dutch Open, on clay courts. He didn't drop a set thorughout the entire tournament.

questions.questionText: What is Roger Federer's best singles Olympic result?
questions.info: Federer's best singles Olympic result is a silver medal at the 2012 London Summer Olympic Games.

questions.questionText: What is Rafael Nadal's best singles Olympic result?
questions.info: Nadal's best singles Olympic result is a gold metal at the 2008 Beijing Summer Olympic Games.

questions.questionText: What is Novak Djokovic's best singles Olympic result?
questions.info: Djokovic's best singles Olympic result is a brozne medal at the 2008 Beijing Summer Olympic Games.

questions.questionText: Who did Roger Federer beat to win his 1st ATP match?
questions.info: Federer won his 1st ATP match against Guillaume Raoux in Toulouse.

questions.questionText: Who did Rafael Nadal beat to win his 1st ATP match?
questions.info: Nadal won his 1st ATP match against Ramón Delgado in Mallorca.

questions.questionText: What was Roger Federer's apparel sponsor between 2018 - 2021?
questions.info: Federer 1st signed with Nike footwear and apparel in 1994 and the sponsor chnaged to Uniqlo in 2018.

questions.questionText: What was Rafael Nadal's apparel sponsor between 2018 - 2021?
questions.info: Nike has sponsored Nadal since 2008 and the sponsorship is still going past 2021!

questions.questionText: What was Novak Djokovic's apparel sponsor between 2018 - 2021?
questions.info: Lacoste has sponsored Djokovic since 2017 and the sponsor has lasted past 2021, over 4 years later!

questions.questionText: What nationality did Djokovic represent in 2004?
questions.info: Djokovic represented Serbia and Montenegro from 2003 - 2006, but since 2006 he has represented Serbia.

questions.questionText: What was Roger Federer's 1st watch sponsor?
questions.info: Federer's 1st watch sponsor was Rolex.

questions.questionText: What was Rafael Nadal's 1st watch sponsor?
questions.info: Nadal's 1st watch sponsor was Richard Mille.

questions.questionText: What was Novak Djokovic's 1st watch sponsor?
questions.info: Djokovic's 1st watch sponsor was Audemars Piguet, but in 2021 his watch sponsor is Hublot.

questions.questionText: What year did Roger Federer win his 5th Slam in?
questions.info: Federer won his 5th Grand Slam, Wimbledon, in 2005.

questions.questionText: What year did Rafael Nadal win his 5th Slam in?
questions.info: Nadal won his 5th Grand Slam, Wimbledon, in 2008.

questions.questionText: What year did Novak Djokovic win his 5th Slam in?
questions.info: Djokovic won his 5th Grand Slam, The Australian Open, in 2012.

questions.questionText: What year did Roger Federer win his 10th Slam in?
questions.info: Federer won his 10th Grand Slam, The Australian Open, in 2007.

questions.questionText: What year did Rafael Nadal win his 10th Slam in?
questions.info: Nadal won his 10th Grand Slam, Roland Garros, in 2011.

questions.questionText: What year did Novak Djokovic win his 10th Slam in?
questions.info: Djokovic won his 10th Grand Slam, The US Open, in 2011.

questions.questionText: What year did Roger Federer win his 15th Slam in?
questions.info: Federer won his 15th Grand Slam, Wimbledon, in 2009.

questions.questionText: What year did Rafael Nadal win his 15th Slam in?
questions.info: Nadal won his 15th Grand Slam, Roland Garros, in 2017.

questions.questionText: What year did Novak Djokovic win his 15th Slam in?
questions.info: Djokovic won his 15th Grand Slam, The Australian Open, in 2019.

questions.questionText: What year did Roger Federer win his 20th Slam in?
questions.info: Federer won his 20th Grand Slam, The Australian Open, in 2018.

questions.questionText: What year did Rafael Nadal win his 20th Slam in?
questions.info: Nadal won his 20th Grand Slam, Roland Garros, in 2020.

questions.questionText: What year did Novak Djokovic win his 20th Slam in?

questions.questionText: How many Wimbledon titles has Roger Federer won?
questions.info: Federer has won 8 Wimbledon titles, an all-time record.

questions.questionText: How many Wimbledon titles has Rafael Nadal won?
questions.info: Nadal has won 2 Wimbledon titles, one quarter of how many Roger Federer has won.

questions.questionText: How many Wimbledon titles has Novak Djokovic won?
questions.info: Djokovic has won 5 Wimbledon titles, 3 more than Nadal, and 3 less than Roger Federer.

questions.questionText: How many Roland Garros titles has Roger Federer won?
questions.info: Federer has won 1 Roland Garros title, 12 less than Nadal.

questions.questionText: How many Roland Garros titles has Rafael Nadal won?
questions.info: Nadal has won 14 French Open titles which is a record for any player, male or female.

questions.questionText: How many Roland Garros titles has Novak Djokovic won?
questions.info: Nadal has won 13 French Open titles which is a record for any player, male or female.

questions.questionText: How many Australian Open titles has Roger Federer won?
questions.info: Federer has won 6 Australian Open titles, his most recent in 2018.

questions.questionText: How many Australian Open titles has Rafael Nadal won?
questions.info: Nadal has won 2 Australian Open titles, his most recent in 2022 after beating Daniil Medvedev in the final.

questions.questionText: How many Australian Open titles has Novak Djokovic won?
questions.info: Djokovic has won 9 Australian Open titles, he's never lost a Australian Open final.

questions.questionText: How many US Open titles has Roger Federer won?
questions.info: Federer has won 5 US Open titles, he's lost 2 US Open finals; one to Djokovic and one to Del Potro.

questions.questionText: How many US Open titles has Rafael Nadal won?
questions.info: Nadal has won 4 US Open titles, and he's lost one in the final to Novak Djokovic.

questions.questionText: How many US Open titles has Novak Djokovic won?
questions.info: Djokovic has won 3 US Open titles, he's lost 6 US Open finals.

questions.questionText: What was the 1st ATP title Roger Federer won?
answers: Grand Prix de Tennis de Toulouse
questions.info: Federer's 1st ATP title was at the 2001 Milan Indoor tournament, where he defeated Julien Boutter in the final.

questions.questionText: What was the 1st ATP title Rafael Nadal won?
questions.info: Nadal's 1st ATP title was at the 2004 Prokom Open tournament, where he defeated José Acasuso in the final.

questions.questionText: What was the 1st ATP title Novak Djokovic won?
questions.info: Djokovic's 1st ATP title was at the 2006 Dutch Open tournament, where he defeated Nicolás Massú in the final.

questions.questionText: What is Roger Federer’s best doubles Olympic result?
questions.info: Federer’s best doubles Olympic result is a gold medal at 2008 Beijing Summer Olympic Games.

questions.questionText: What is Rafael Nadal’s best doubles Olympic result?
questions.info: Nadal’s best doubles Olympic result is a gold medal at 2016 Rio Summer Olympic Games.

questions.questionText: What is Novak Djokovic’s best doubles Olympic result?
questions.info: Djokovic’s best doubles Olympic result is no medal at all. Djokovic doesn’t have any doubles medal at the Summer Olympic Games.

questions.questionText: What is Roger Federer’s height?
questions.info: Federer is 6 foot 1 inch tall.

questions.questionText: What is Rafael Nadal’s height?
questions.info: Nadal is 6 foot 1 inch tall.

questions.questionText: What is Novak Djokovic’s height?
questions.info: Djokovic is 6 foot 2 inches tall.

questions.questionText: At what age did Roger Federer 1st start playing tennis?
questions.info: Federer started playing tennis when he was 8 years old, although at the time he also dabbled in other sports such as badminton and basketball.

questions.questionText: At what age did Rafael Nadal 1st start playing tennis?
questions.info: Nadal began playing tennis at age three, coached by his uncle, Toni Nadal, who remained his coach on the professional tour.

questions.questionText: At what age did Novak Djokovic 1st start playing tennis?
questions.info: Djokovic began playing tennis at age four, after his parents gave him a mini-racket and a soft foam ball.

questions.questionText: Which Masters tournament has Rafael Nadal not won?
questions.info: Nadal has not yet won the Miami Masters tournament.

questions.questionText: In 2010, Rafael Nadal was in a music video. What song was this music video for?
answers: Call Me Maybe - Carly Rae Jepsen
questions.info: Nadal appeared in the music video for Gypsy, by the famous Canadian singer Shakira.

questions.questionText: Roger Federer starred in a commercial for Switzerland called "No Drama" with what celebrity?
questions.info: Federer appeared in a commercial with American actor Robert de Niro.

questions.questionText: Which 2012 movie did Novak Djokovic shoot for but had his part edited out of the actual movie?
questions.info: Djokovic was planned to have a cameo in the movie The Expendabes 2, and they even filmed for it, but it never made it into the movie.

questions.questionText: In 2010, Novak Djokovic was in a music video. What song was this music video for?
questions.info: Djokovic appeared in the music video for Hello, by the popular artist Martin Solveig.

questions.info: Federer has citizenship in Switzerland and South Africa.

questions.questionText: Where is Alex de Minuar from?
questions.info: Alex de Minuar is Australian, but has Spanish citizenship too!

questions.questionText: Where is Damir Džumhur from?
questions.info: Damir Džumhur is from Bosnia and Herzegovina, and he also resides there.

questions.questionText: Where is Ricardas Berankis from?
questions.info: Ricardas Berankis is from Lithunia, and he resides in both Florida and Vilnius, Lithunia.

questions.questionText: Where is Casper Ruud from?
questions.info: Casper Ruud is from Norway, and he resides in Oslo, the capital of Norway.

questions.questionText: How many Grand Slams did Rod Laver win?
questions.info: Rod Laver won 11 Grand Slams in his career.

questions.questionText: How many singles Grand Slams has Venus Williams won?
questions.info: Venus Williams has won 7 singles Grand Slams, her latest being the 2008 Wimbledon.

questions.questionText: How many doubles Grand Slams has Venus Williams won?
questions.info: Venus Williams has won 14 doubles Grand Slams, all with her sister Serena.

questions.questionText: When did Naomi Osaka turn pro?
questions.info: Naomi Osaka turned pro in 2013, when she was just 16 years old.

questions.questionText: When did Billie Jean King retire?
questions.info: Billie Jean King retired in 1983, when she was 40 years old.

questions.questionText: How many Grand Slams has Roger Federer won?
questions.info: Roger Federer has won 20 Grand Slams.

questions.questionText: Which of these players has won all 9 masters tournaments?
questions.info: Novak Djokovic has won all 9 masters tournaments, more than once too!

questions.questionText: Who did John McEnroe defeat in the final to win his 1st Wimbledon singles title?
questions.info: In 1981, John McEnroe won his 1st Wimbledon singles title by defeating Bjorn Borg in the final.

questions.questionText: What year did tennis 1st become an Olympic sport?
questions.info: Tennis was originally introduced as an Olympic sport in 1896, but was removed from competition after the 1924 games; and then added back in 1988.

questions.questionText: What color were tennis balls before they were yellow?
questions.info: The color of tennis balls were white before they were yellow.

questions.questionText: How many Masters tournaments are there each year?
questions.info: There are 9 different masters tournaments each year.

questions.questionText: How long was the longest tennis match ever?
questions.info: The longest tennis match in history lasted 11 hours and 5 minutes.

questions.questionText: The longest match ever was played by which 2 players?
questions.info: The longest tennis match in history was played by John Isner and Nicolas Mahut.

questions.questionText: What was the speed of the fastest serve ever?
questions.info: The record for fastest tennis serve is held by Samuel Groth, when he hit a serve reaching 263 kph/163 mph.

questions.questionText: Who hit the fastest serve ever?
questions.info: The record for fastest tennis serve is held by Samuel Groth, when he hit a serve reaching 263 kph/163 mph.

questions.questionText: How many shots were hit in the longest professional rally ever?
questions.info: The record for longest professional rally ever lasted 643 shots, and was played by Vicki Nelson and Jean Hepner in 1984.

questions.questionText: How fast was the shortest Grand Slam final ever?
questions.info: The record for shortest Grand Slam final is held by Steffi Graf. The match lasted 32 minutes total.

questions.questionText: Who won the famous "Battle of the Sexes"?
questions.info: In September of 1973, Billie Jean King beat Bobby Riggs in straight sets in the famous "Battle of the Sexes".

questions.questionText: What is the maximum amount of points a tennis player can win from a single tournament?
questions.info: A player can win up to 2,000 points from a single Grand Slam tournament.

questions.questionText: Who was the 1st Asian woman to be ranked world No. 1 in the world?
questions.info: Naomi Osaka was the 1st asian woman to become No. 1 in the world.

questions.questionText: In 1988, who won the Grand Slam and the Olympic gold medal in tennis??
questions.info: Steffi Graf won the Golden Grand Slam in 1988, by winning the Calendar Grand Slam and the Olympic gold medal.

questions.questionText: Who was the 1st African-American tennis player to win Wimbledon?
questions.info: Althea Gibson won Wimbleton in 1957, making her the 1st African-American tennis player to win Wimbledon.

questions.questionText: How many seats does the Royal Box have at Wimbledon?
questions.info: The Royal Box has 74 seats.

questions.questionText: What is the average distance run in a best of 3 sets tennis match?
questions.info: Tennis players run an average of 3 miles (5 km) in a best of 3 set match.

questions.questionText: How many languages does Novak Djokovic fluently speak?
questions.info: Novak Djokovic is fluent in Serbian, English, German, French, and Italian. Djokovic also knows some phrases in Arabic, Japanese, Spanish, Russian, Chinese, and Portuguese.

questions.questionText: What were the 1st tennis racket strings made of?
questions.info: The 1st tennis racket strings were made out of sheep gut.

questions.questionText: What surface was the US Open played on before it was played on hard courts?
questions.info: The US Open was played on grass courts before it was played on hard courts.

questions.questionText: Where is the US Open played?
questions.info: The US Open is played at Flushing Meadows, but used to be played at Forest Hills.

questions.questionText: Which of these players has the most years finished as No. 1 in the world?
questions.info: Djokovic has the most years finished as No. 1 with 7 years.

questions.questionText: Who was the 1st unseeded player to win the men's singles at Wimbledon?
questions.info: Boris Becker was the 1st unseeded player to win the men's singles at Wimbledon.

questions.questionText: Who won the women's Roland Garros in 2019?
questions.info: Ashleigh Barty won Roland Garros in 2019, beating Markéta Vondroušová.

questions.questionText: What color must be primarily worn by the players at Wimbledon?
questions.info: White must be the primary color that players wear at Wimbledon.

questions.questionText: Who was the 1st male player to win 100 tournaments in the Open Era?
questions.info: Jimmy Connors was the 1st player in the Open Era to win more than 100 ATP singles titles, which he achieved in 1983.

questions.questionText: Who was the 1st male player to get to the semi-finals of a Grand Slam since 2009?
questions.info: Sam Querrey was the 1st male player to get to the semi-finals of a Grand Slam since 2009, which he did by beating Andy Murray at the 2017 Wimbledon.

questions.questionText: Who was the 1st American male player to get to the semi-finals of a Grand Slam since 2009?
questions.info: Sam Querrey was the 1st American male player to get to the semi-finals of a Grand Slam since 2009, which he did by beating Andy Murray at the 2017 Wimbledon.

questions.questionText: Who was the only American to win Wimbledon in the 60s?
questions.info: Chuck McKinley was the only American tennis player to win Wimbledon in the 1960s.

questions.questionText: Which siblings have won the Wimbledon mixed doubles?
questions.info: John and Tracy Austin won the Wimbledon mixed doubles in 1980s.

questions.questionText: What was the 1st tournament Carlos Alcaraz won?
questions.info: The 1st tournament Carlos Alcaraz won was the Croatia Open in Umag.

questions.questionText: Who is the 1st mens No. 1 other than Djokovic, Nadal, Federer and Murray since 2005?
questions.info: Daniil Medvedev was the 1st mens No. 1 other than Djokovic, Nadal, Federer and Murray since Roddick in February 2004.
